docs.title: Rocky Linux SIG/Database Wiki
docs.text: The Rocky Database ecosystem is built on the world's fastest-growing open-source enterprise operating system.

docs.title: Meetings / Communications
docs.text: Please visit Meetings page to view upcoming meetings. You can also visit RESF Calendar to add SIG/Database Events to your calendar.

docs.title: Contribute
docs.text: There are various ways to get in touch with SIG/Database. Please visit Contribute page.

docs.title: Members
docs.text: Please visit Members page for details of Members

docs.title: About
docs.text: Rocky Linux, like any other Linux distribution, can be used as a platform for developing and running databases and their supporting applications. The operating system provides a stable and reliable environment for running various databases, such as Greenplum, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, and many more.

docs.title: Community
docs.text: Rocky SIG/Database has active communities at Rocky Linux Mattermost and Rocky Linux Forums

docs.title: Contact US
docs.text: Reach out to us for any talks related to incorporating your Open Source Database into the Rocky Database Ecosystem. We are happy to talk... SIG/Database Mattermost

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Rocky SIG Database has open contribution opportunities at each level. Participaiton requires you to do the following things:

  • Create an account at Rocky Linux Mattermost.
  • Create an account at Rocky Linux Forums
  • Find SIG/Database in channels list and introduce yourself.
  • Reach out to SIG/Database channel and post your findings, difficulties, help needed etc.
  • For any urgent or cold case requests ping channel admins.

docs.title: SIG/Database Resources
docs.text:
• git.resf.org/sig_database/wiki contains the source file of very webpage that you are seeing.
  • git.resf.org/sig_database/meta repo addresses/handles the issues related to SIG/Database access/administration/accounts.
